nodes.bodyText: fromPacket
Don't need a separate name for what's effectively overloads of the same method. All the serialization methods are changed to read/write, all the factory/producer methods have been changed to create.
No, serialization methods should still follow yarn convention, i.e. fromXxx/toXxx or (de)serialize for dynamics

Missing closing tag
this is not needed
It's HTML. If you have an opening tag HTML syntax says you have to have a closing tag
tags do not need a closing tag in HTML (it's one of the automatically inferred closing tags in HTML), and it's especially not part of Yarn's javadoc style.

nodes.bodyText: IMO screenHandler is better here.
This is a field. private final ScreenHandler screenHandler; is not too redundant and is more clear for cases such as this.screenHandler versus this.handler.

Yeah screen handler is really a weird case, like if you are a particle, you may have a particle manager and resource manager; these cases are confusing unfortunately. In general, handler is too vague.
Except there's really only one handler. I don't see any possibility for confusion here.
